name: Homemade Tahini
author: SFChef
summary: Tahini is a staple in Middle Eastern cooking. It's added to mashed garbanzo beans to make hummus, mixed with date paste, or drizzled with pekmez in Turkey for breakfast. It tastes great in sandwiches or baked into cookies. Really, there are many many uses for this tasty dip. Start with the freshest sesame seeds you can find.
ingredients: 2 ½ cups olive oil, or to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Spread sesame seeds on a rimmed baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven, shaking the baking sheet frequently, until seeds are lightly toasted, 5 to 10 minutes
Pour cooled seeds and 1 1/2 cups olive oil into a food processor
Add more oil and blend until a thick yet pourable consistency is reached
